step_1.step_text: Make sure the car is parked on level ground. Then, pop the hood using the lever under the dashboard.

step_2.step_text: Use the hood prop to hold up the hood.

step_3.step_text: Remove dipstick from engine and clean it with a shop cloth.

step_4.step_text: Re-insert the dipstick into the engine. Then, remove it, but don't clean the end this time.

step_5.step_text: Inspect the end of the dipstick with the metal tip. You should see wet oil up to the top of the hash marks.

step_6.step_text: If the oil level is too low, then open the oil cap on the valve cover and add oil, re-cleaning the dipstick and checking oil level every 1/2 quart that you add.

step_7.step_text: After oil level is back up to normal, close the valve cover and idle the engine for 3-5 minutes.

step_8.step_text: Confirm one last time that the oil level is appropriate by repeating steps 3-6.
